name: n-hexyl acetate
Reason: 1,3-dioxolane has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the n-hexyl group (C(C)OCCCCCC) increases the molecular weight and size, which raises the melting point. The acetate group introduces a carbonyl functional group, which can participate in dipole interactions and hydrogen bonding, further raising the melting point. The n-hexyl group also introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and potentially hydrogen bonding, further raising the melting point. The net effect should thus be a decreased melting point but not as low as the increase observed with ethanol's hydrogen bonding alone.
